Interface IPclServiceCallback


  • public interface IPclServiceCallback

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • shouldFeedPaper

        void shouldFeedPaper(int lines)
        Called when the Telium application wants to feed paper.
        Parameters:
        lines - Number of lines

      • shouldCutPaper

        void shouldCutPaper()
        Called when the Telium application wants to cut paper, indicating the ticket is finished.

      • shouldPrintText

        void shouldPrintText(java.lang.String text,
                     byte font,
                     byte justification,
                     byte xfactor,
                     byte yfactor,
                     byte underline,
                     byte bold)
        Called when the Telium application wants to print text.
        Parameters:
        text - String containing the text to be printed
        font - The font identifier
        justification - Indicates text alignment (0=centered, 1=right, 2=left)
        xfactor - The factor by which the text should be scaled in the X direction. Possible values are 1, 2 or 4 (normal, double or quadruple text width).
        yfactor - The factor by which the text should be scaled in the Y direction. Possible values are 1, 2 or 4 (normal, double or quadruple text width)
        underline - Indicates whether text must be underlined (1) or not (0)
        bold - Indicates whether text must be bold (1) or not (0)

      • shouldPrintImage

        void shouldPrintImage(android.graphics.Bitmap image,
                      byte justification)
        Called when the Telium application wants to print image.
        Parameters:
        image - Bitmap containing the image to be printed
        justification - Indicates image alignment (0=centered, 1=right, 2=left)

      • shouldDoSignatureCapture

        void shouldDoSignatureCapture(int pos_x,
                              int pos_y,
                              int width,
                              int height,
                              int timeout)
        Called when the Telium application needs signature capture. This function must call submitSignatureWithImage or setSignatureCaptureResult.
        Parameters:
        pos_x - X position of the signature capture window
        pos_y - Y position of the signature capture window
        width - Width of the signature capture window
        height - Height of the signature capture window
        timeout - Timeout (in ms) to do the signature capture

      • signatureTimeoutExceeded

        void signatureTimeoutExceeded()
        Called when the capture signature timeout has been reached.

      • shouldAddSignature

        void shouldAddSignature()
        Called when the Telium application wants to add signature to the receipt.

      • shouldStartReceipt

        int shouldStartReceipt(byte type)
        Called when the Telium application wants to start printing a receipt.
        Parameters:
        type - Indicates the receipt type (0=merchant, 1=customer)
        Returns:
        0 in case of success

      • shouldEndReceipt

        int shouldEndReceipt()
        Called when the Telium application wants to end printing a receipt.
        Returns:
        0 in case of success

      • shouldPrintRawText

        void shouldPrintRawText(byte[] text,
                        byte charset,
                        byte font,
                        byte justification,
                        byte xfactor,
                        byte yfactor,
                        byte underline,
                        byte bold)
        Called when the Telium application wants to print raw text (encoding has to be managed by application)
        Parameters:
        text - String containing the text to be printed
        charset - Charset to be used to encode raw text
        font - The font identifier
        justification - Indicates text alignment (0=centered, 1=right, 2=left)
        xfactor - The factor by which the text should be scaled in the X direction. Possible values are 1, 2 or 4 (normal, double or quadruple text width).
        yfactor - The factor by which the text should be scaled in the Y direction. Possible values are 1, 2 or 4 (normal, double or quadruple text width)
        underline - Indicates whether text must be underlined (1) or npt (0)
        bold - Indicates whether text must be bold (1) or npt (0)
